intro: Asagraea sabadilla, commonly known as sabadilla, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Liliaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its bulbs are used in traditional medicine and as a source of alkaloids. However, it is important to note that the plant contains toxic compounds and should be handled with care.
